00192 /**
00193  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
00194  * \brief Spatially binned vertex IDs
00195  *
00196  * \description
00197  *
00198  *    This is a helper structure to look up vertices by spatial
00199  *    location. Because the bin structure is a regularly structured
00200  *    grid, it is easy to identify which bin a given set of 
00201  *    coordinates is in. Then search for a vertexID is reduced to
00202  *    searching only the vertexIDs in this single bin instead of
00203  *    the entire mesh.
00204  *
00205  * \todo ? someday move mesh bounding box into mesh
00206  * \modifications
00207  *    - 03/08/04 WSK, Created.
00208  */
00209 typedef struct {
00210   FC_Mesh mesh;            /**< The owning mesh */
00211   FC_Variable displ;       /**< The displacement variable or FC_NULL_VARIABLE */
00212   int numDim;              /**< Dimensionality of coordinate system of mesh */
00213   // Had to change these to get them to swig
00214   //FC_CoordslowerCoords;   /**< Bounding box of owning mesh */
00215   //FC_Coords upperCoords;   /**< Bounding box of owning mesh */
00216   double lowerCoords[3];   /**< Bounding box of owning mesh */
00217   double upperCoords[3];   /**< Bounding box of owning mesh */
00218   double widths[3];        /**< Widths of bounding box of owning mesh */
00219   int numBins[3];          /**< Number of bins in each dimensions */
00220   double binWidths[3];     /**< Width of each dimension of the bins */
00221   int*** numVertex;        /**< Number of vertices per bin, eg num[i][j][k] */
00222   int**** vertexIDs;       /**< Vertex IDs per bin, eg IDs[i][j][k][n] */
00223 } FC_VertexBin;
00224

00226 FC_ReturnCode fc_createDisplacedMeshVertexBin(FC_Mesh mesh,
